H2998.def: Ibnijah = "whom Jehovah will build up"; 1) a Benjamite

H2999.def: Jabbok = "emptying"; 1) a stream which intersects the mountain range of Gilead,  and falls into the Jordan on the east about midway between the Sea of Galilee and the Dead Sea

H3000.def: Jeberechiah = "Jehovah blesses"; 1) father of a Zechariah,  in the reign of Ahaz and time of Isaiah

H3001.def: 1) to make dry,  wither,  be dry,  become dry,  be dried up,  be withered; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to be dry,  be dried up,  be without moisture; 1a2) to be dried up; 1b) (Piel) to make dry,  dry up; 1c) (Hiphil); 1c1) to dry up,  make dry; 1c1a) to dry up (water); 1c1b) to make dry,  wither; 1c1c) to exhibit dryness

H3003.def: Jabesh = "dry"; n pr loc; 1) a town in the territory of Gilead; according to Eusebius,  it is beyond the Jordan,  6 miles (10 km) from Pella,  on the mountain road to Gerasa; site unknown but may be modern 'Wadi Yabes'; n pr m; 2) father of Shallum,  the 15th king of the northern kingdom
H3003.derivation: the same as  (also ; often with the addition of , i.e. Jabesh of Gilad);

H3005.def: Jibsam = "pleasant"; 1) one of the sons of Tola and a grandson of Issachar

H3007.def: 1) the earth (as a planet); 2) dry land

H3008.def: Igal or Igeal = "He redeems"; 1) son of Joseph and a spy from the tribe of Issachar; 2) son of Nathan of Zobah,  one of David's mighty warriors; 3) a son of Shemaiah and descendant of Zerubbabel

H3011.def: Jogbehah = "lofty"; 1) one of the cities east of the Jordan which was built and fortified by the tribe of Gad

H3012.def: Igdaliah = "Jehovah is great"; 1) a prophet or holy man and father of Hanan in the time of Josiah

H3013.def: 1) to afflict,  grieve,  suffer,  cause grief; 1a) (Niphal) grieved,  grieving (participle); 1b) (Piel) to grieve; 1c) (Hiphil) to cause grief,  cause sorrow

H3014.def: 1) (Hiphil) to repel,  thrust away,  push away
H3014.derivation: a primitive root (probably rather the same as  through the common idea of dissatisfaction);

H3017.def: Jagur = "he sojourns"; 1) a town of Judah,  one of those farthest to the south,  on the frontier of Edom

H3018.def: 1) toil,  work; 2) product,  produce,  acquired property (as a result of work)

H3020.def: Jogli = "he is exiled"; 1) a Danite and father of Bukki who was one of the 12 rulers charged with the conquest of Canaan

H3021.def: 1) to toil,  labour,  grow weary,  be weary; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to toil,  labour; 1a2) to grow weary,  be weary; 1b) (Piel) to weary, make weary,  cause to go toilsomely; 1c) (Hiphil) to make to toil,  make weary,  cause to be weary

H3026.def: Jegar-sahadutha = "witness heap"; 1) the mound of stones raised as witness between Jacob and Laban, called by Jacob in Hebrew 'Galeed'
H3026.derivation: (Aramaic) from a word derived from an unused root (meaning to gather) and a derivation of a root corresponding to ; heap of the testimony;

H3027.def: 1) hand; 1a) hand (of man); 1b) strength,  power (fig.); 1c) side (of land),  part,  portion (metaph.) (fig.); 1d) (various special,  technical senses); 1d1) sign,  monument; 1d2) part,  fractional part,  share; 1d3) time,  repetition; 1d4) axle-trees,  axle; 1d5) stays,  support (for laver); 1d6) tenons (in tabernacle); 1d7) a phallus,  a hand (meaning unsure); 1d8) wrists
H3027.derivation: a primitive word; in distinction from , the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows)

H3030.def: Idalah = "memorial of God"; 1) a town in Zebulun between Shimron and Bethlehem,  site unknown

H3031.def: Idbash = "stout"; 1) one of the 3 sons of Abi-etam,  a descendant of Judah
H3031.derivation: from the same as ; perhaps honeyed;

H3032.def: v; 1) (Qal) to throw lots,  cast lots; n; 2) love,  loving-one,  friend

H3033.def: 1) one dearly loved,  beloved one,  object of love

H3034.def: 1) to throw,  shoot,  cast; 1a) (Qal) to shoot (arrows); 1b) (Piel) to cast,  cast down,  throw down; 1c) (Hiphil); 1c1) to give thanks,  laud,  praise; 1c2) to confess,  confess (the name of God); 1d) (Hithpael); 1d1) to confess (sin); 1d2) to give thanks
H3034.derivation: a primitive root; used only as denominative from ; literally, to use (i.e. hold out) the hand;

H3035.def: Iddo = "timely" or "lovely"; 1) son of Zechariah,  ruler of the tribe of Manasseh east of the Jordan in the time of David; 2) a man who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra

H3036.def: Jadon = "thankful"; 1) a Meronothite and one of the builders of the walls of Jerusalem

H3037.def: Jaddua = "knowing"; 1) one of the chiefs of the people who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah; 2) son and successor in the high priesthood of Jonathan,  Jeshua, or Johanan; the last of the high priests mentioned in the OT,  probably living in the time of Alexander the Great

H3038.def: Jeduthun = "praising"; 1) a Levite of the family of Merari and the chief of one of the 3 choirs of the temple whose descendants also formed one of the perpetual temple choirs; he is named at the beginning of 3 Psalms (Ps 39:1; 62:1; 77:1) either as the composer or the recipient of those Psalms but most likely as the leader of the choir by which those Psalms were to be sung

H3039.def: n m; 1) one beloved,  beloved; adj; 2) lovely

H3040.def: Jedidah = "beloved"; 1) the wife of king Amon and mother of king Josiah

H3041.def: Jedidiah = "beloved of Jehovah"; 1) the name given to Solomon through Nathan the prophet

H3042.def: Jedaiah = "praised of Jehovah"; 1) a Simeonite,  forefather of Ziza; 2) son of Harumaph and one who took part in rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem

H3043.def: Jediael = "God makes known"; 1) a chief patriarch of the tribe of Benjamin; maybe the same as 'Ashbel'; 2) the 2nd son of Meshelemiahand a Korahite gatekeeper; 3) son of Shimri and one of David's mighty warriors; 4) one of the chiefs of the thousands of Manasseh who joined David on his march to Ziklag; maybe the same man as 3 above

H3045.def: 1) to know; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to know; 1a1a) to know,  learn to know; 1a1b) to perceive; 1a1c) to perceive and see,  find out and discern; 1a1d) to discriminate,  distinguish; 1a1e) to know by experience; 1a1f) to recognise,  admit,  acknowledge,  confess; 1a1g) to consider; 1a2) to know,  be acquainted with; 1a3) to know (a person carnally); 1a4) to know how,  be skilful in; 1a5) to have knowledge,  be wise; 1b) (Niphal); 1b1) to be made known,  be or become known,  be revealed; 1b2) to make oneself known; 1b3) to be perceived; 1b4) to be instructed; 1c) (Piel) to cause to know; 1d) (Poal) to cause to know; 1e) (Pual); 1e1) to be known; 1e2) known,  one known,  acquaintance (participle); 1f) (Hiphil) to make known,  declare; 1g) (Hophal) to be made known; 1h) (Hithpael) to make oneself known,  reveal oneself

H3046.def: 1) to know; 1a) (P'al) to know; 1b) (Aphel) to let someone know,  communicate,  inform,  cause to know

H3047.def: Jada = "He knows"; 1) a Judahite,  son of Onam and brother of Shammai,  in the genealogy of the sons of Jerahmeel by his wife Atarah

H3048.def: Jedaiah = "Jehovah has known"; 1) a priest in Jerusalem; 2) a man who returned with Zerubbabel; 3) a ruler of the priests in the days of Jeshua; 4) a post exilic priest; 5) one honoured by Jehovah,  perhaps one of the above

H3049.def: 1) a knower,  one who has a familiar spirit; 1a) a familiar spirit,  soothsayer,  necromancer (meton)

H3050.def: 1) Jah (Jehovah in the shortened form); 1a) the proper name of the one true God; 1b) used in many compounds; 1b1) names beginning with the letters 'Je'; 1b2) names ending with 'iah' or 'jah'
H3050.derivation: contraction for , and meaning the same;

H3051.def: 1) to give,  provide,  ascribe,  come; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to give; 1a2) to set,  place; 1a3) to provide (with reflexive); 1a4) to ascribe (glory); 1a5) to grant,  permit,  come now

H3052.def: 1) to give,  provide; 1a) (P'al); 1a1) to give; 1a2) to place,  lay (foundations); 1b) (Hithp'al); 1b1) to be given; 1b2) to be paid

H3054.def: 1) (Hithpael) to become a Jew (in fact or in fraud),  become Judaised
H3054.derivation: denominative from a form corresponding to ;

H3055.def: Jehud = "beauty"; 1) a town in Dan,  located between Baalath and Bene-berak and 8 miles east of Joppa
H3055.derivation: a briefer form of one corresponding to ;

H3056.def: Jahdai "whom he will place"; 1) one of the family of Caleb
H3056.derivation: perhaps from a form corresponding to ; Judaistic;

H3057.def: adj f; 1) the Jewess; Jehudijah = Jewess; n pr f; 2) (CLBL) a Calebite,  the wife of one named Ezra

H3058.def: Jehu = "Jehovah is He"; 1) the king of the northern kingdom Israel who overthrew the dynasty of Omri; 2) son of Hanani and an Israelite prophet in the time of Baasha and Jehoshaphat; 3) the Antothite,  a Benjamite,  one of David's mighty warriors; 4) a descendant of Judah of the house of Hezron; 5) son of Josibiah and a chief of the tribe of Simeon

H3059.def: Jehoahaz = "Jehovah has seized"; 1) a king of Judah and son of Josiah; 2) a king of the northern kingdom of Israel and son of Jehu; 3) a king of Judah and son of Jehoram (Ahaziah)

H3060.def: Jehoash = "given by the Lord"; 1) son of king Ahaziah and the 8th king of Judah; 2) son of king Jehoahaz and the 12th king of the northern kingdom of Israel

H3061.def: 1) Judah-the territory of the tribe of Judah
H3061.derivation: (Aramaic) contracted from a form corresponding to ;

H3063.def: Judah = "praised"; 1) the son of Jacob by Leah; 2) the tribe descended from Judah the son of Jacob; 3) the territory occupied by the tribe of Judah; 4) the kingdom comprised of the tribes of Judah and Benjamin which occupied the southern part of Canaan after the nation split upon the death of Solomon; 5) a Levite in Ezra's time; 6) an overseer of Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah; 7) a Levite musician in the time of Nehemiah; 8) a priest in the time of Nehemiah

H3065.def: Jehudi = "Jew"; 1) son of Nethaniah and servant of king Jehoiakim

H3066.def: 1) in the Jewish language,  in Hebrew

H3067.def: Judith = "Jewess" or "praised"; 1) the daughter of Beeri the Hittite and wife of Esau

H3068.def: Jehovah = "the existing One"; 1) the proper name of the one true God; 1a) unpronounced except with the vowel pointings of  H0136

H3069.def: 1) Jehovah-used primarily in the combination 'Lord Jehovah'; 1a) equal to  H03068 but pointed with the vowels of  H0430
H3069.derivation: a variation of  (used after , and pronounced by Jews as , in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce  as )

H3070.def: Jehovah-jireh = "Jehovah sees"; 1) symbolic name given by Abraham to Mount Moriah in commemoration of the interposition of the angel of Jehovah who prevented the sacrifice of Isaac and provided a substitute
H3070.derivation: from  and ; Jehovah will see (to it);

H3071.def: Jehovah-nissi = "Jehovah is my banner"; 1) the name given by Moses to the altar which he built in commemoration of the discomfiture of the Amalekites
H3071.derivation: from  and  with the prononimal suffix; Jehovah (is) my banner;

H3072.def: Jehovah is our righteousness; 1) a sacred name symbolically applied to Jerusalem and the Messiah
H3072.derivation: from  and  with pronominal suffix; Jehovah (is) our right;

H3073.def: Jehovah-shalom = "Jehovah is peace"; 1) the name of a sacred altar built by Gideon in Ophrah

H3074.def: Jehovah-shammah = "Jehovah is there"; 1) a symbolic name for Jerusalem
H3074.derivation: from  and  with directive enclitic; Jehovah (is) thither;

H3075.def: Jehozabad = "Jehovah has endowed"; 1) son of Shomer,  a Moabitish woman,  who murdered Joash,  king of Judah; 2) a Benjamite,  captain of 180,000 armed men,  in the days of Jehoshaphat; 3) a Korhite Levite,  2nd son of Obededom,  and one of the porters of the temple and of the storehouse there in the time of David

H3076.def: Jehohanan = "Jehovah has graced"; 1) a priest during the high priesthood of Joiakim who returned with Zerubbabel; 2) a high priest in the time of Ezra; 3) a Levite priest who took part in the dedication of the wall in the time of Nehemiah; 4) son of Tobiah; 5) a Korhite Levite and one of the doorkeepers to the tabernacle in the time of David; 6) a captain of Judah under king Jehoshaphat; 7) an Ephraimite; 8) an Israelite with a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 9) a Jewish captain after the fall of Jerusalem; 10) the eldest son of king Josiah; 11) a post-exilic prince of the line of David; 12) father of Azariah,  priest in Solomon's time; 13) a Benjamite,  one of David's mighty warriors; 14) a Gadite,  one of David's mighty warriors; 15) a returning exile

H3077.def: Jehoiada = "Jehovah knows"; 1) father of Benaiah,  David's mighty warrior; 2) leader of the priests who joined David at Hebron; 3) high priest at the time of Athaliah's usurpation of the throne of Judah; hid Joash,  the king's son,  for six years and eventually replaced him on the throne of Judah; 4) second priest,  or sagan,  to Seraiah the high priest

H3078.def: Jehoiachin = "Jehovah establishes"; 1) king of Judah,  son of Jehoiakim,  and the next to last king of Judah before the Babylonian captivity; kingship lasted for 3 months and 10 days before he surrendered to Nebuchadnezzar who took him to Babylon and imprisoned him for 36 years when he was finally released

H3079.def: Jehoiakim = "Jehovah raises up"; 1) son of Josiah and the third from the last king of Judah; subject vassel of Nebuchadnezzar who reigned for 11 years before he died a violent death either in combat or by the hands of his own subjects
H3079.derivation: from  abbreviated and ; Jehovah will raise;

H3080.def: Jehoiarib = "Jehovah contends"; 1) A priest in Jerusalem; 2) the head of the 1st of the 24 courses of priests in David's time

H3081.def: Jehucal = "Jehovah is able"; 1) a son of Shelemiah and a servant of king Zedekiah whom he sent to Jeremiah to entreat his prayers and advice

H3082.def: Jehonadab = "Jehovah is willing"; 1) a son of Rechab,  chief of the Rechabites,  in the time of Jehu and Ahab; 2) a nephew of David

H3083.def: Jonathan or Jehonathan = "Jehovah has given"; 1) a son of king Saul and a friend of David; 2) a son of the high priest Abiathar and the last descendant of Eli of whom we hear; 3) a nephew of David who like David slew a giant of Gath; 4) an uncle of David; 5) one of David's mighty warriors; 6) one of David's treasurers; 7) a scribe in the time of Jeremiah; 8) a Levite and father of Zechariah,  a priest who blew the trumpet at the dedication of the wall; 9) a son or descendant of Gershom,  the son of Moses,  and a priest to the tribe of Dan; 10) a son of Kareah and a brother of Johanan; a Judaite captain after the fall of Jerusalem; 11) another Judaite father of Peleth; 12) father of Ebed in the time of Ezra; 13) son of Asahel in the time of Ezra; 14) a priest of the family of Melicu in the time of Nehemiah; 15) son of Joiada and his successor to the high priesthood in the time of Nehemiah

H3084.def: Joseph = "Jehovah has added"; 1) the eldest son of Jacob by Rachel

H3085.def: Jehoadah = "Jehovah has adorned"; 1) a descendant of Saul through Jonathan

H3086.def: Jehoaddan = "Jehovah delights"; 1) wife of king Joash and mother of king Amaziah of Judah

H3087.def: Jehozadak or Josedech = "Jehovah is righteous"; 1) grandson of the high priest Hilkiah; son of the high priest Seraiah; and father of the high priest Joshua; he never attained the office of high priest himself because he was carried captive to Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar

H3088.def: Jehoram or Joram = "Jehovah is exalted"; 1) son of king Jehoshaphat of Judah and himself king of Judah for 8 years; his wife was the wicked Athaliah who was probably the instigator for his returning the nation of Judah to the worship of Baal; 2) son of king Ahab of the northern kingdom of Israel and king of Israel himself for 12 years; he was murdered by Jehu on the plot of land for which his father had murdered Naboth thus fulfilling the prophecy of Elijah to the very letter; 3) a priest in the reign of Jehoshaphat

H3089.def: Jehosheba = "Jehovah has sworn"; 1) daughter of king Joram of Judah and wife of the high priest Jehoiada; 1a) alternate spelling 'Jehoshabeath' - H03090

H3090.def: Jehoshabeath = "Jehovah is an oath"; 1) daughter of king Joram of Judah and wife of the high priest Jehoiada; 1a) alternate spelling 'Jehosheba- H3089

H3091.def: Joshua or Jehoshua = "Jehovah is salvation"; n pr m; 1) son of Nun of the tribe of Ephraim and successor to Moses as the leader of the children of Israel; led the conquest of Canaan; 2) a resident of Beth-shemesh on whose land the Ark of the Covenant came to a stop after the Philistines returned it; 3) son of Jehozadak and high priest after the restoration; 4) governor of Jerusalem under king Josiah who gave his name to a gate of the city of Jerusalem

H3092.def: Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah has judged"; n pr m; 1) son of king Asa and himself king of Judah for 25 years; one of the best,  most pious,  and prosperous kings of Judah; 2) son of Nimshi and father of king Jehu of the northern kingdom of Israel; 3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon; 4) son of Paruah and one of the 12 commissary officers under Solomon; 5) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David; n pr loc; 6) symbolical name of a valley near Jerusalem which is the place of ultimate judgment; maybe the deep ravine which separates Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives through which the Kidron flowed

H3094.def: Jehaleleel or Jehalelel = "God is praised"; 1) a Calebite descendant of Judah; 2) father of Azariah and a Merarite Levite in the time of Hezekiah

H3095.def: 1) a precious stone (known for its hardness); 1a) perhaps the jasper,  onyx,  or diamond

H3096.def: Jahaz or Jahazah or Jahzah = "trodden down"; 1) a place in Reuben east of the Dead Sea where Israel defeated Sihon king of the Amorites; site uncertain
H3096.derivation: or ; or (feminine) ; from an unused root meaning to stamp; perhaps threshing-floor;

H3097.def: Joab = "Jehovah is father"; 1) son of David's sister Zeruiah and general of David's army; 2) a Judaite descendant of Kenaz; 3) a post exilic family

H3098.def: Joah = "Jehovah is brother"; 1) son of Asaph and chronicler to Hezekiah; 2) a Gershonite son or grandson of Zimmah; 3) a Korhite,  3rd son of Obed-edom and doorkeeper in the time of David; 4) son of Joahaz and chronicler to king Josiah

H3099.def: Joahaz or Jehoahaz = "Jehovah has grasped"; 1) the father of Joah,  Josiah's chronicler

H3100.def: Joel = "Jehovah is God"; 1) son of Pethuel and the 2nd of the 12 minor prophets with a book by his name; probably prophesied in the time of king Uzziah of Judah; 2) eldest son of Samuel the prophet and father of Heman the singer; 3) a Simeonite chief; 4) a Reubenite; 5) a chief of Gad; 6) son of Izrahiah and a chief of Issachar; 7) brother of Nathan of Zobah and one of David's mighty warriors; 8) son of Pedaiah and a chief of the half tribe of Manasseh west of the Jordan in the time of David; 9) a son of Nebo who returned with Ezra and had a foreign wife; 10) a Benjamite,  son of Zichri; 11) a Levite; 12) a Kohathite Levite in the reign of Hezekiah; 13) a Gershonite Levite chief in the time of David; 14) a Gershonite Levite,  son of Jehiel and a descendant of Laadan; maybe same as 13

H3101.def: Joash = "given by the Lord"; 1) son of king Ahaziah and the 8th king of Judah; 2) son of king Jehoahaz and the 12th king of the northern kingdom of Israel; 3) father of Gideon; 4) a son of king Ahab; 5) a descendant of Shelah the son of Judah; either the son of Shelah or the son of Jokim; 6) son of Shemaah of Gibeah who resorted to David at Ziklag

H3102.def: Job = "persecuted"; 1) the 3rd son of Issachar also called 'Jashub'
H3102.derivation: perhaps a form of , but more probably by erroneous transcription for ;

H3103.def: Jobab = "a desert"; 1) the last in order of the sons of Joktan,  a descendant of Shem; 2) one of the kings of Edom; 3) the king of Madon,  located in northern Canaan,  and one of the kings who opposed Joshua during the conquest and who were routed at Meron; 4) head of a Benjamite house; 5) another Benjamite

H3104.def: 1) ram,  ram's horn,  trumpet,  cornet; 1a) ram (only in combination); 1a1) ram's horn,  trumpet; 1b) jubilee year (marked by the blowing of cornets) (meton)

H3106.def: Jubal = "stream"; 1) the son of Lamech by Adah and the inventor of musical instruments

H3107.def: Jozabad or Josabad = "Jehovah has endowed"; 1) a Korhite Levite,  2nd son of Obededom,  and one of the porters of the temple and of the storehouse there in the time of David; 2) one of David's mighty warriors; 3) another of David's mighty warriors; 4) four other priests or Levites

H3108.def: Jozachar = "Jehovah remembers"; 1) a servant of king Joash of Judah and one of his murderers; 1a) also called 'Zabad'

H3109.def: Joha = "Jehovah gives life"; 1) one of the sons of Beriah the Benjamite; 2) the Tizite,  one of David's mighty warriors
H3109.derivation: probably from  and a variation of ; Jehovah-revived;

H3110.def: Johanan = "Jehovah has graced"; 1) a priest during the high priesthood of Joiakim who returned with Zerubbabel; 2) a Jewish captain after the fall of Jerusalem; 3) the eldest son of king Josiah; 4) a post-exilic prince of the line of David; 5) father of Azariah,  priest in Solomon's time; 6) a Benjamite,  one of David's mighty warriors; 7) a Gadite,  one of David's mighty warriors; 8) a returning exile

H3111.def: Joiada or Jehoiada = "Jehovah knows"; 1) son of Paseah,  who assisted to repair the old gate of Jerusalem; 2) son of the high priest Eliashib in the time of Nehemiah

H3112.def: Jehoiachin = "Jehovah establishes"; 1) king of Judah,  son of Jehoiakim,  and the next to last king of Judah before the Babylonian captivity; kingship lasted for 3 months and 10 days before he surrendered to Nebuchadnezzar who took him to Babylon and imprisoned him for 36 years when he was finally released

H3113.def: Joiakim or Jehoiakim = "Jehovah raises up"; 1) a priest and son of Jeshua the high priest

H3114.def: Joiarib = "Jehovah contends"; 1) the head of the 1st of the 24 courses of priests in David's time; 2) a teacher in the time of Ezra; 3) a Judaite in the time of Nehemiah

H3115.def: Jochebed = "Jehovah is glory"; 1) the daughter of Levi,  wife and at the same time aunt of Amram,  and the mother of Moses,  Aaron, and Miriam

H3116.def: Jucal = "Jehovah is able"; 1) a son of Shelemiah and a servant of king Zedekiah whom he sent to Jeremiah to entreat his prayers and advice

H3117.def: 1) day,  time,  year; 1a) day (as opposed to night); 1b) day (24 hour period); 1b1) as defined by evening and morning in Genesis 1; 1b2) as a division of time; 1b2a) a working day,  a day's journey; 1c) days,  lifetime (pl.); 1d) time,  period (general); 1e) year; 1f) temporal references; 1f1) today; 1f2) yesterday; 1f3) tomorrow
H3117.derivation: from an unused root meaning to be hot;

H3118.def: 1) day; 2) day always refers to a twenty-four hour period when the word is modified by a definite or cardinal number

H3119.def: adv; 1) by day,  in the daytime; subst; 2) daytime

H3120.def: Javan = "Ionia" or "Greece"; n pr m; 1) a son of Japheth and grandson of Noah; n pr loc; 2) Greece, Ionia, Ionians; 2a) location of descendants of Javan
H3120.derivation: probably from the same as ; effervescing (i.e. hot and active);

H3122.def: Jonadab or Jehonadab = "Jehovah is willing"; 1) a son of Rechab,  chief of the Rechabites,  in the time of Jehu and Ahab; 2) a nephew of David

H3124.def: Jonah = "dove"; 1) son of Amittai and a native of Gath-hepher; 5th of the minor prophets who prophesied during the reign of Jeroboam II and whom God sent also to prophecy to Nineveh

H3128.def: Jonath-elem-recho-kim = "the silent dove of far-off places"; 1) meaning uncertain; 1a) probably name of melody; 1b) only used in title of Ps 56:1
H3128.derivation: from  and  and the plural of ;

H3129.def: Jonathan or Jehonathan = "Jehovah has given"; 1) a son of king Saul and a friend of David; 2) a son of the high priest Abiathar and the last descendant of Eli of whom we hear; 3) one of David's mighty warriors; 4) a Levite and father of Zechariah,  a priest who blew the trumpet at the dedication of the wall; 5) a son of Kareah and a brother of Johanan; a Judaite captain after the fall of Jerusalem; 6) another Judaite; 7) father of Ebed in the time of Ezra; 8) son of Asahel in the time of Ezra; 9) a priest of the family of Melicu in the time of Nehemiah; 10) son of Joiada and his successor to the high priesthood in the time of Nehemiah

H3130.def: Joseph = "Jehovah has added"; 1) the eldest son of Jacob by Rachel; 2) father of Igal,  who represented the tribe of Issachar among the spies; 3) a son of Asaph; 4) a man who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 5) a priest of the family of Shebaniah in the time of Nehemiah
H3130.derivation: future of ; let him add (or perhaps simply active participle adding);

H3131.def: Josiphiah = "Jehovah adds"; 1) father or ancestor of Shelomith who returned with Ezra
H3131.derivation: from active participle of  and ; Jah (is) adding;

H3132.def: Joelah = "may he avail"; 1) son of Jeroham of Gedor and one of David's mighty warriors
H3132.derivation: perhaps feminine active participle of ; furthermore;

H3133.def: Joed = "Jehovah is witness"; 1) a Benjamite,  son of Pedaiah
H3133.derivation: apparently the active participle of ; appointer;

H3134.def: Joezer = "Jehovah is help"; 1) a Korhite,  one of David's mighty warriors who joined him at Ziklag

H3135.def: Joash = "Jehovah hastens"; 1) a Benjamite,  son of Becher; 2) one of the officers in David's court

H3136.def: Jozadak = "Jehovah is righteous"; 1) grandson of the high priest Hilkiah; son of the high priest Seraiah; and father of the high priest Joshua; he never attained the office of high priest himself because he was carried captive to Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar

H3137.def: Jokim = "Jehovah raises up"; 1) a descendant of Judah

H3138.def: 1) early rain,  autumn shower; 1a) rain which falls in Palestine from late October until early December

H3139.def: Jorah = "he instructs"; 1) the head or ancestor of a family who returned from Babylon with Ezra

H3140.def: Jorai = "Jehovah has taught me"; 1) one of the Gadites dwelling at Gilead in Bashan in the reign of king Jotham of Judah

H3141.def: Joram = "Jehovah is exalted"; 1) son of king Jehoshaphat of Judah and himself king of Judah for 8 years; his wife was the wicked Athaliah who was probably the instigator for his returning the nation of Judah to the worship of Baal; 2) son of king Ahab of the northern kingdom of Israel and king of Israel himself for 12 years; he was murdered by Jehu on the plot of land for which his father had murdered Naboth thus fulfilling the prophecy of Elijah to the very letter; 3) a Levite in the time of David and an ancestor of Shelomith; 4) son of Toi,  king of Hamath

H3142.def: Jushab-hesed = "whose love is returned"; 1) son of Zerubbabel
H3142.derivation: from  and ; kindness will be returned;

H3143.def: Josibiah = "Jehovah causes to dwell"; 1) a Simeonite,  father of Jehu
H3143.derivation: from  and ; Jehovah will cause to dwell;

H3144.def: Joshah = "Jehovah makes equal"; 1) a prince of the house of Simeon

H3145.def: Joshaviah = "Jehovah makes equal"; 1) son of Elnaam and one of David's mighty warriors

H3146.def: Joshaphat or Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah judges"; n pr m; 1) one of David's mighty warriors; 2) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David

H3147.def: Jotham = "Jehovah is perfect"; 1) son of king Uzziah of Judah by Jerushah; king of Judah for 16 years and contemporary with Isaiah and king Pekah of Israel; 2) son of Jahdai and a descendant of Caleb and Judah; 3) youngest son of Gideon who escaped from the massacre of his brothers

H3148.def: n m; 1) superiority,  advantage,  excess; adv; 2) excess,  better; conj; 3) besides,  moreover,  more

H3149.def: Jeziel = "the assembly of God"; 1) a Benjamite and one of David's mighty warriors who joined him at Ziklag
H3149.derivation: from an unused root (meaning to sprinkle) and ; sprinkled of God;

H3150.def: Jeziah = "Jehovah sprinkles"; 1) a descendant of Parosh who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra
H3150.derivation: from the same as the first part of  and ; sprinkled of Jah;

H3151.def: Jaziz = "He makes prominent"; 1) a Hagarite,  officer of David in charge of the flocks
H3151.derivation: from the same as ; he will make prominent;

H3152.def: Jezliah = "whom God will preserve"; 1) a Benjamite of the sons of Elpaal
H3152.derivation: perhaps from an unused root (meaning to draw up); he will draw out;

H3153.def: Jezaniah = "Jehovah has listened"; 1) son of Hoshaiah the Maachathite and one of the captains who escaped from Jerusalem during the last siege of the Babylonians; one of the first to return to Gedaliah at Mizpah where he took a prominent part after the assassination of Gedaliah

H3154.derivation: from an unused root mean to ooze;

H3155.def: Izrahite = "descendant of Zerah"; 1) a descendant of Zerah of Judah

H3156.def: Izrahiah or Jezrahiah = "Jehovah will shine"; 1) a chieftain of Issachar; 2) a Levite and leader of the chorus at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem under Nehemiah

H3157.def: Jezreel = "God sows"; n pr m; 1) a descendant of the father or founder of Etam of Judah; 2) first son of Hosea the prophet; n pr loc; 3) a city in the Nekeb of Judah; 4) a city in Issachar on the northwest spur of Mount Gilboa

H3158.def: Jezreelite = see Jezreel "sown of God"; 1) an inhabitant of Jezreel

H3159.def: Jezreelitess = see Jezreel "sown of God"; 1) a female inhabitant of Jezreel; 1a) used only of Ahinoam,  a wife of David

H3160.def: Jehubbah = "hidden"; 1) a man of Asher,  son of Shomer or Shamer of the house of Beriah

H3161.def: 1) to join,  unite,  be joined,  be united; 1a) (Qal) to be united; 1b) (Piel) to unite

H3162.def: n m; 1) union,  unitedness; adv; 2) together,  altogether,  all together,  alike

H3163.def: Jahdo = "His unity"; 1) a Gileadite,  son of Buz and father of Jeshishai
H3163.derivation: from  with pronominal suffix; his unity, i.e. (adverb) together;

H3164.def: Jahdiel = "my unity is God"; 1) a chief of Manasseh on the east of the Jordan

H3165.def: Jehdeiah = "Jehovah is unity"; 1) a Levite in the time of David; 2) a Meronothite,  officer of David in charge of the she-asses

H3166.def: Jahaziel = "beheld of God"; 1) a Benjamite warrior who joined David at Ziklag; 2) a priest in the reign of David who helped move the ark; 3) a Kohathite Levite,  3rd son of Hebron; 4) a Levite,  son of Zechariah,  of the sons of Asaph,  in the reign of Jehoshaphat; 5) an ancestor of one of the families who returned from exile with Ezra

H3167.def: Jahaziah = "Jehovah views"; 1) son of Tikvah,  apparently a priest and leader during the time of Ezra

H3168.def: Ezekiel or Jehezekel = "God strengthens"; 1) son of Buzi and a priest and prophet; author of the book by his name; taken captive with Jehoiachin and exiled in Babylon where he prophesied for the next 22 years; 2) a priest in charge of the 20th course in the time of David

H3169.def: Hezekiah or Jehizkiah = "Jehovah has made strong"; 1) son of king Ahazby Abi or Abijah and the 12th king of Judah; his reign was characterised by his godly conduct; reigned for 29 years; 2) head of a family of returning exiles in the time of Nehemiah; 3) an Ephraimite in the time of Ahaz
H3169.derivation: or ; from  and ; strengthened of Jah;

H3170.def: Jahzerah = "whom God leads back"; 1) a priest of the house of Immer
H3170.derivation: from the same as ; perhaps protection;

H3171.def: Jehiel = "God lives"; 1) a Levite and one of the chief musicians in the time of David; 2) a Gershonite Levite who had charge of the treasures in the time of David; 3) son of Hachmoni and an officer of David and tutor of David's sons; 4) a son of king Jehoshaphat of Judah put to death by his brother Jehoram; 5) Hemanite who took part in the restoration of king Hezekiah; 6) a Levite and overseer in the time of Hezekiah; 7) a ruler of the temple during the reforms of Josiah; 8) father of Obadiah of the sons of Joab in the time of Ezra; 9) father of Shechaniah of the sons of Elam in the time of Ezra; 10) a son of Elam who put away his foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 11) a priest of the sons of Harim who also had to put away his foreign wife in the time of Ezra
H3171.derivation: or (2 Chronicles 29:14) ; from  and ; God will live;

H3172.def: Jehieli = "God shall save alive" or "swept away of God"; 1) a Gershonite Levite of the family of Laadan

H3173.def: adj; 1) only,  only one,  solitary,  one; 1a) only,  unique,  one; 1b) solitary; 1c)(TWOT) only begotten son; subst; 2) one

H3174.def: Jehiah = "Jehovah lives"; 1) doorkeeper of the ark at the time of its establishment in Jerusalem

H3176.def: 1) to wait,  hope,  expect; 1a) (Niphal) to wait; 1b) (Piel); 1b1) to wait,  await,  tarry; 1b2) to wait for,  hope for; 1c) (Hiphil) to wait,  tarry,  wait for,  hope for

H3177.def: Jahleel = "God waits"; 1) the 3rd of the 3 sons of Zebulun; founder of the family of the Jahleelites

H3178.def: Jahleelites = "the hope of God"; 1) descendants of Jahleel of the tribe of Zebulun

H3179.def: 1) to be hot,  conceive; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to be hot,  become hot; 1a2) to mate (of animals); 1a3) to be or become hot (fig. of anger); 1b) (Piel); 1b1) to conceive (sexually); 1b2) to be in heat (of animals)

H3180.def: 1) roebuck; 1a) a kind of deer,  reddish in colour; 1b) perhaps an extinct animal,  exact meaning unknown

H3181.def: Jahmai = "whom Jehovah guards"; 1) a man of Issachar and one of the heads of the family of Tola

H3182.derivation: from an unused root meaning to take off the shoes;

H3183.def: Jahzeel = "God divides"; 1) the 1st of the 4 sons of Naphtali and founder of the family of Jahzeelites

H3184.def: Jahzeelites = see Jahzeel "God divides"; 1) the descendants of Jahzeel,  the 1st son of Naphtali

H3185.def: Jahziel = "God divides"; 1) the 1st of the 4 sons of Naphtali and founder of the family of Jahzeelites

H3187.def: 1) (Hithpael) to reckon genealogically,  enrol on a genealogy,  enrol, be enrolled
H3187.derivation: a primitive root; to sprout; used only as denominative from ;

H3189.def: Jahath = "He will snatch up"; 1) son of Reaiah and grandson of Shobal of the tribe of Judah; 2) a son of Libni and grandson of Gershom and great grandson of Levi; 3) a Gershonite Levite; the eldest son of Shimei and the grandson of Laadan; founder of the house of Jahath; 4) a Levite and son of Shelomoth; 5) a Merarite Levite in the reign of Josiah

H3190.def: 1) to be good,  be pleasing,  be well,  be glad; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to be glad,  be joyful; 1a2) to be well placed; 1a3) to be well for,  be well with,  go well with; 1a4) to be pleasing,  be pleasing to; 1b) (Hiphil); 1b1) to make glad,  rejoice; 1b2) to do good to,  deal well with; 1b3) to do well,  do thoroughly; 1b4) to make a thing good or right or beautiful; 1b5) to do well,  do right

H3191.def: 1) (P'al) to be good,  do good,  be pleasing

H3192.def: Jotbah = "pleasing"; 1) a city in Judah,  hometown of Meshullemeth,  wife of king Manasseh; 1a) site unknown

H3193.def: Jotbath or Jotbathah = "pleasantness"; 1) a stopping place in the wilderness; site unknown

H3194.def: Juttah = "stretched out"; 1) a town in the mountains of Judah,  in the neighbourhood of Maon and Carmel; modern 'Yutta'

H3195.def: Jetur = "enclosed"; 1) a son of Ishmael whose descendants warred with Israel east of the Jordan; 1a) also called 'Ituraea'
H3195.derivation: probably from the same as ; encircled (i.e. inclosed);

H3196.derivation: from an unused root meaning to effervesce;

H3198.def: 1) to prove,  decide,  judge,  rebuke,  reprove, correct,  be right; 1a) (Hiphil); 1a1) to decide,  judge; 1a2) to adjudge,  appoint; 1a3) to show to be right,  prove; 1a4) to convince,  convict; 1a5) to reprove,  chide; 1a6) to correct,  rebuke; 1b) (Hophal) to be chastened; 1c) (Niphal) to reason,  reason together; 1d) (Hithp) to argue

H3199.def: Jachin = "He will establish"; n pr m; 1) the 4th son of Simeon and founder of the family of Jachinites; 2) a priest and the head of the 21st coursein the time of David; 3) a post-exilic priest in the time of Nehemiah; n pr; 4) name of the right-hand pillar before the temple

H3200.def: Jachinites = see Jachin "he will establish"; 1) the descendants of Jachin

H3201.def: 1) to prevail,  overcome, endure,  have power,  be able; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to be able,  be able to gain or accomplish,  be able to endure, be able to reach; 1a2) to prevail,  prevail over or against,  overcome,  be victor; 1a3) to have ability,  have strength

H3202.def: 1) to be able; 1a) (P'al); 1a1) to be able; 1a2) to prevail

H3203.def: Jecoliah or Jecholiah = "Jehovah is able"; 1) wife of king Amaziah of Judah and mother of king Uzziah (Azariah)
H3203.derivation: and ; or (2 Chronicles 26:3) ; from  and ; Jah will enable;

H3204.def: Jeconiah = "Jehovah will establish"; 1) son of king Jehoiakim of Judah and king of Judah for 3 months and 10 days before he surrendered to Nebuchadnezzar and was taken captive to Babylon where he was imprisoned for the next 36 years; released at the death of Nebuchadnezzar and lived in Babylon until his death; 1a) primary spelling 'Jehoiachin'
H3204.derivation: and ; or (Jeremiah 27:20) ; from  and ; Jah will establish;

H3205.def: 1) to bear,  bringforth,  beget,  gender,  travail; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to bear,  bring forth; 1a1a) of child birth; 1a1b) of distress (simile); 1a1c) of wicked (behaviour); 1a2) to beget; 1b) (Niphal) to be born; 1c) (Piel); 1c1) to cause or help to bring forth; 1c2) to assist or tend as a midwife; 1c3) midwife (participle); 1d) (Pual) to be born; 1e) (Hiphil); 1e1) to beget (a child); 1e2) to bear (fig. -of wicked bringing forth iniquity); 1f) (Hophal) day of birth,  birthday (infinitive); 1g) (Hithpael) to declare one's birth (pedigree)

H3206.def: 1) child,  son,  boy,  offspring,  youth; 1a) child,  son,  boy; 1b) child,  children; 1c) descendants; 1d) youth; 1e) apostate Israelites (fig.)

H3210.def: Jalon = "Jehovah lodges"; 1) a son of Ezra and a descendant of Caleb

H3212.def: 1) to go, walk,  come; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to go,  walk,  come,  depart,  proceed,  move,  go away; 1a2) to die,  live,  manner of life (fig.); 1b) (Hiphil) to lead,  bring,  lead away,  carry,  cause to walk

H3213.def: 1) (Hiphil) to howl,  wail,  make a howling

H3216.def: 1) (Qal) to speak rashly,  talk wildly; 1a) (TWOT) to swallow,  swallow down

H3217.def: 1) scab,  skin sore,  scales,  scurf,  an eruptive disease
H3217.derivation: from an unused root apparently meaning to stick or scrape;

H3218.def: 1) young locust (early stage of development); 1a) caterpillar (as devouring)
H3218.derivation: from an unused root meaning to lick up;

H3220.def: 1) sea; 1a) Mediterranean Sea; 1b) Red Sea; 1c) Dead Sea; 1d) Sea of Galilee; 1e) sea (general); 1f) mighty river (Nile); 1g) the sea (the great basin in the temple court); 1h) seaward,  west,  westward
H3220.derivation: from an unused root meaning to roar;

H3222.def: 1) meaning uncertain,  meaning perhaps mules or hot springs

H3223.def: Jemuel = "day of God"; 1) the eldest son of Simeon

H3224.def: Jemima = "day by day"; 1) one of the daughters of Job born after the restoration
H3224.derivation: perhaps from the same as ; properly, warm, i.e. affectionate; hence, dove (compare );

H3225.def: 1) right,  right hand,  right side; 1a) right hand; 1b) right (of direction); 1c) south (the direction of the right hand when facing East)

H3226.def: Jamin = "right hand"; 1) the 2nd son of Simeon; founder of the family of Jaminites; 2) a Judaite,  the 2nd son of Ram the Jerahmeelite; 3) a Levite who helped Ezra interpret the Law

H3227.def: 1) right,  on the right,  right hand

H3228.def: Jaminites = see Jamin "the right hand"; 1) the descendants of Jamin

H3229.def: Imlah or Imla = "whom God will fill up"; 1) father of Michaiah the prophet

H3230.def: Jamlech = "He will reign"; 1) a chief of the tribe of Simeon

H3231.def: 1) (Hiphil) to choose the right,  go to the right,  use the right hand, be right handed
H3231.derivation: a primitive root; to be (physically) right (i.e. firm); but used only as denominative from  and transitive,

H3232.def: Imna or Imnah or Jimnah = "right hand"; n pr m; 1) the 1st born son of Asher; 2) a Levite,  descendant of Imnah,  who assisted in the reforms of Hezekiah; n patr; 3) descendants of Imnah,  son of Asher
H3232.derivation: from ; prosperity (as betokened by the right hand);

H3234.def: Imna = "He will restrain"; 1) son of Helem,  descendant of Asher,  and leader of the tribe of Asher

H3235.def: 1) to exchange; 1a) (Hiphil) to exchange; 1b) (Hithpael) to enter into,  be changed into; 2) (TWOT) to promise

H3236.def: Imrah = "bitterness"; 1) a descendant of Asher of the family of Zophah and a chief of the tribe

H3238.def: 1) to oppress,  suppress,  treat violently,  maltreat, vex,  do wrong; 1a) (Qal) to oppress,  suppress; 1b) (Hiphil) to treat violently,  maltreat

H3239.def: Janoah or Janohah = "He rests"; 1) a place apparently in the north of Galilee in Naphtali,  taken by Tiglath-pileser in his first incursion into Palestine

H3240.def: 1) to rest; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to rest,  settle down and remain; 1a2) to repose,  have rest,  be quiet; 1b) (Hiphil); 1b1) to cause to rest,  give rest to,  make quiet; 1b2) to cause to rest,  cause to alight,  set down; 1b3) to lay or set down,  deposit,  let lie,  place; 1b4) to let remain,  leave; 1b5) to leave,  depart from; 1b6) to abandon; 1b7) to permit; 1c) (Hophal); 1c1) to obtain rest,  be granted rest; 1c2) to be left,  be placed; 1c3) open space (subst)

H3241.def: Janum = "asleep"; 1) a town in the mountains of Judah apparently not far from Hebron

H3243.def: 1) to suckle,  nurse,  suck; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to suck; 1a2) suckling,  babe (subst); 1b) (Hiphil); 1b1) to give suck to,  nurse; 1b2) nursing,  nursing woman,  nurse (participle)

H3244.def: 1) great owl,  eared owl; 1a) an unclean animal

H3245.def: 1) to found, fix,  establish, lay foundation; 1a) (Qal) to found,  establish,  begin; 1b) (Niphal); 1b1) to fix or seat themselves close together,  sit in conclave; 1b2) to be founded; 1c) (Piel); 1c1) to found; 1c2) to establish,  appoint,  ordain; 1d) (Pual) to be founded,  be laid; 1e) (Hophal) to be founded

H3246.def: 1) a beginning,  foundation,  that being founded

H3252.def: Iscah = "one who looks forth"; 1) daughter of Haran,  niece of Abraham,  sister of Lot and Milcah
H3252.derivation: from an unused root meaning to watch; observant;

H3253.def: Ismachiah = "Jehovah sustains"; 1) a Levite and overseer of the offerings during the revival in the time of king Hezekiah

H3254.def: 1) to add,  increase,  do again; 1a) (Qal) to add,  increase,  do again; 1b) (Niphal); 1b1) to join,  join oneself to; 1b2) to be joined,  be added to; 1c) (Hiphil); 1c1) to cause to add,  increase; 1c2) to do more,  do again

H3256.def: 1) to chasten,  discipline,  instruct,  admonish; 1a)(Qal); 1a1) to chasten,  admonish; 1a2) to instruct; 1a3) to discipline; 1b) (Niphal) to let oneself be chastened or corrected or admonished; 1c) (Piel); 1c1) to discipline,  correct; 1c2) to chasten,  chastise; 1d) (Hiphil) to chasten; 1e) (Nithpael) to teach

H3258.def: Jabez = "sorrow"; n pr m; 1) the head of a Calebite family; n pr loc; 2) a town in Judah apparently near Bethlehem
H3258.derivation: from an unused root probably meaning to grieve; sorrowful;

H3259.def: 1) to fix,  appoint,  assemble,  meet,  set, betroth; 1a)(Qal) to appoint,  assign,  designate; 1b) (Niphal); 1b1) to meet; 1b2) to meet by appointment; 1b3) to gather,  assemble by appointment; 1c) (Hiphil) to cause to meet; 1d) (Hophal) to be set,  be placed before,  be fixed

H3260.def: Iddo = "appointed"; 1) the seer who proclaimed to king Jeroboam of Israel

H3261.def: 1) (Qal) to sweep,  sweep away,  sweep together

H3262.def: Jeuel = "God sweeps away"; 1) son of Zerah and a chief man of Judah
H3262.derivation: from  and ; carried away of God;

H3263.def: Jeuz = "counsellor"; 1) head of a house of Benjamin

H3265.def: Jair = "forested"; 1) father of Elhanan the giant slayer,  one of David's mighty warriors; 1a) also called 'Jaare-oregim'
H3265.derivation: apparently the passive participle of the same as ; wooded;

H3266.def: Jehush or Jeush = "He hurries to aid"; 1) son of Eshek,  a remote descendant of king Saul; 2) a Gershonite Levite of the house of Shimei; 3) son of king Rehoboam of Judah

H3267.def: 1) to be strong,  be fierce (meaning dubious); 1a) (Niphal) barbarous (participle)

H3268.def: Jaaziel = "made bold by God"; 1) one of the Levites appointed by David to perform the musical service before the ark

H3269.def: Jaaziah = "made bold by Jehovah"; 1) a Levite,  apparently the 3rd son or a descendant of Merari

H3270.def: Jazer or Jaazer = "helped"; 1) a Levitical city east of the Jordan,  in Gilead in the territory of Gad,  formerly an Amorite city; site uncertain

H3272.def: 1) (Ithpael)  to advise,  counsel,  take counsel; 2) (P'al) counsellor (participle)

H3273.def: Jeiel or Jehiel = "God sweeps away"; 1) one of the sons of Adonikam who returned from exile with Ezra; 2) a chief Reubenite of the house of Joel; 3) a Merarite Levite and a gatekeeper to the tabernacle who also played the harp and psaltery in the service before the ark; 4) one of the chiefs of the Levites in the time of king Josiah; 5) one of the sons of Nebo who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 6) a man of Gibeon and ancestor of king Saul; 7) one of the sons of Hotham the Aroerite and one of David's mighty warriors; 8) the scribe of king Uzziah who kept the account of the king's irregular predatory warriors; 9) a Gershonite Levite of the sons of Elizaphan; 10) a Gershonite Levite of the sons of Asaph and forefather of Jahaziel in the time of king Jehoshaphat
H3273.derivation: from  and ; carried away of God;

H3274.def: Jeush = "assembler"; 1) son of Esau by Aholibamah the daughter of Anah,  son of Zibeon the Hivite; 2) a Benjamite,  son of Bilhan

H3275.def: Jachan = "troublesome"; 1) one of seven chief men of the tribe of Gad

H3278.def: Jael = "mountain goat"; 1) the wife of Heber the Kenite who killed the general Sisera as he slept by driving a peg through his temples into the ground

H3279.def: Jaala or Jaalah = "ascending"; 1) the head of a family of the descendants of Solomon's slaves who returned from exile with Zerubbabel
H3279.derivation: or ; the same as  or direct from ;

H3281.def: Jaalam = "concealed"; 1) an Edomite,  descendant of Esau

H3282.def: conj; 1) because,  therefore,  because that,  on account of; prep; 2) because of,  on account of; 3) why (with interrogative pron)
H3282.derivation: from an unused root meaning to pay attention;

H3284.def: 1) an unclean bird; 1a) owl,  ostrich,  literally translated as "daughters of the owl"; 1b) perhaps an extinct bird,  exact meaning unknown
H3284.derivation: feminine of , and meaning the same

H3285.def: Jaanai = "whom Jehovah answers"; 1) a chief man in the tribe of Gad

H3286.def: 1) to be or grow weary,  be fatigued,  be faint; 1a) (Qal) to be or grow weary,  be fatigued,  be faint; 1b) (Hophal) wearied (participle)

H3449.def: Ishiah or Ishijah or Jesiah = "Jehovah will lend"; 1) a Korhite,  one of David's mighty warriors who joined him at Ziklag; 2) the 5th of 5 sons of Izrahiah and one of the heads of the tribe of Issachar in the time of David; 3) a Levite,  the 2nd son of Uzziel and grandson of Kohath; 4) another Levite,  son of Rehabiah; 5) a descendant of Harim who had a foreign wife

H3470.def: Isaiah or Jesaiah or Jeshaiah = "Jehovah has saved"; 1) the major prophet,  son of Amoz,  who prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem during the days of kings Uzziah,  Jotham,  Ahaz,  and Hezekiah of Judah; author of the prophetic book by his name; tradition has it that he was sawn asunder in the trunk of a carob tree by king Manasseh and that this is the incident referred to in Heb 11:37; 2) son of Hananiah,  brother of Pelatiah,  and grandson of Zerubbabel; 3) a Benjamite; 4) one of the 6 sons of Jeduthun; 5) son of Rehabiah,  a descendant of Moses through Gershom,  and an ancestor of a Levite treasurer in the time of David; 6) son of Athaliah and chief of the house of Elam who returned with Ezra; 7) a chief of the descendants of Merari who returned with Ezra
H3470.derivation: or ; from  and ; Jah has saved;

H3479.def: Israel = "God prevails"; 1) the second name for Jacob given to him by God after his wrestling with the angel at Peniel; 2) the name of the descendants and the nation of the descendants of Jacob; 2a) the name of the nation until the death of Solomon and the split; 2b) the name used and given to the northern kingdom consisting of the 10 tribes under Jeroboam; the southern kingdom was known as Judah; 2c) the name of the nation after the return from exile

H3999.def: 1) flood,  deluge.; 1a) Noah's flood that submerged the entire planet earth under water for about a year; ++++; Some think Noah's flood was only local. However the description of it found in Gen. 6 through 8 makes this patently absurd. If it was local, Noah had 120 years to migrate out of the area to safe ground! Why waste all that effort building a ship? He only had to move less than 1500 feet a day to reach the farthest point on the globe! With the possible exception of Ps 29:10,  this word always refers to Noah's flood. The real reason for insisting on a local flood is the acceptance of evolution with its long geological ages. Most holding that view are not willing to allow a global world wide flood to have happened less than 5000 years ago. To admit such eliminates the need for the geological ages for most of the geological column would have been rapidly laid down by Noah's flood.
H3999.derivation: from  in the sense of flowing;

H4327.def: 1) kind,  sometimes a species (usually of animals); ++++; Groups of living organisms belong in the same created "kind" if they have descended from the same ancestral gene pool. This does not preclude new species because this represents a partitioning of the original gene pool. Information is lost or conserved not gained. A new species could arise when a population is isolated and inbreeding occurs. By this definition a new species is not a new "kind" but a further partitioning of an existing "kind".
H4327.derivation: from an unused root meaning to portion out;

H5705.def: prep; 1) even to, until, up to,  during; conj; 2) until,  up to the time that,  ere that

H5706.derivation: the same as  in the sense of the aim of an attack;

H5707.def: 1) witness; 1a) witness,  testimony,  evidence (of things); 1b) witness (of people)

H5708.def: 1) menstruation; 1a) filthy rag,  stained garment (fig. of best deeds of guilty people)
H5708.derivation: from an unused root meaning to set a period (compare , );

H5709.def: 1) to pass on, pass away; 1a)(P'al); 1a1) to pass on,  pass over; 1a2) to pass away; 1b) (Aphel) to take away,  remove,  depose

H5710.def: 1) to pass on,  advance,  go on,  pass by,  remove; 1a) (Qal) to pass on,  put on; 1b) (Hiphil) to remove

H5711.def: Adah = "ornament"; 1) the 1st of the 2 wives of Lamech and mother of Jabal and Jubal; 2) a Hittitess,  1 of the 3 wives of Esau and mother of Eliphaz; 2a) also called 'Bashemath'

H5712.derivation: feminine of  in the original sense of fixture;

H5713.def: 1) testimony,  witness; 1a) always plural and always of laws as divine testimonies
H5713.derivation: feminine of  in its techn. sense;

H5714.def: Iddo = "His witness"; 1) father of Abinadab,  an officer of Solomon; 2) grandfather of the prophet Zechariah; 3) a Gershonite Levite,  son of Joah; 4) a priest in the time of Nehemiah; 5) a seer in the time of king Jeroboam of the northern kingdom of Israel; 6) son of Zechariah,  ruler of the tribe of Manasseh in the time of David; 7) a chief of the temple slaves who assembled at Casiphia at the time of the 2nd caravan from Babylon

H5716.derivation: from  in the sense of trappings;

H5717.def: Adiel = "ornament of God"; 1) a prince of the Simeon of the family of Shimei in the time of king Hezekiah of Judah; 2) a priest,  ancestor of Maasiai; 3) ancestor of Azmaveth,  the treasurer of David

H5718.def: Adaiah = "Jehovah has adorned Himself"; 1) maternal grandfather of king Josiah of Judah and native of Boscath in the lowlands of Judah; 2) a Gershonite Levite and ancestor of Asaph; 3) a Benjamite,  son of Shimhi; 4) a priest,  son of Jehoram; 5) ancestor of Maaseiah,  one of the captains who supported Jehoiada; 6) a descendant of Bani who had a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 7) a descendant of another Bani who had a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 8) a descendant of Pharez of the tribe of Judah
H5718.derivation: or ; from  and ; Jah has adorned;

H5720.def: Adin = "dainty" or "delicate"; 1) ancestor of a family of exiles who returned with Zerubbabel; 2) a chief among the returned exiles who signed the covenant with Nehemiah

H5721.def: Adina = "slender"; 1) a chief of the Reubenites,  and a captain of David

H5722.def: Adino = "his ornament"; 1) one of David's mighty warriors
H5722.derivation: probably from  in the original sense of slender (i.e. a spear);

H5723.def: Adithaim = "double ornament"; 1) a town in the lowland of Judah
H5723.derivation: dual of a feminine of ; double prey;

H5724.def: Adlai = "justice of Jehovah"; 1) ancestor of Shaphat,  the overseer of David's herds
H5724.derivation: probably from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

H5725.def: Adullam = "justice of the people"; 1) a town of the Canaanites allotted to Judah and lying in the lowlands; site of the cave where David hid
H5725.derivation: probably from the passive participle of the same as ;

H5726.def: Adullamite = see Adullam "justice of the people"; 1) an inhabitant of Adullam

H5729.def: Eden = "pleasure"; 1) a place conquered by Assyria; probably located in the northwest of Mesopotamia

H5731.def: Eden= "pleasure"; n pr m loc; 1) the first habitat of man after the creation; site unknown; n pr m; 2) a Gershonite Levite,  son of Joah in the days of king Hezekiah of Judah

H5732.derivation: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of ;

H5733.def: Adna = "rest" or "pleasure"; 1) one of the family of Pahath-moab who returned with Ezra and married a foreign wife; 2) a priest,  descendant of Harim in the days of Joiakim,  the son of Jeshua

H5734.def: Adnah = "pleasure"; 1) a Manassite who deserted from Saul and joined David at Ziklag; 2) a captain in charge of over 300,000 men of Judah in the time of Jehoshaphat

H5735.def: Adadah = "festival" or "boundary"; 1) one of the towns in the extreme south of Judah

H5736.def: 1) to remain over,  be in excess; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to be in excess; 1a1a) excess (subst); 1a1b) surplus (participle); 1b) (Hiphil) to have a surplus

H5737.def: 1) to help; 1a) (Qal) to help; 2) to hoe; 2a) (Niphal) to be hoed; 3) to be lacking,  fail; 3a)(Niphal); 3b1) to be lacking; 3b1) to leave lacking; 3b) (Piel) to leave lacking

H5738.def: Ader = "flock"; 1) a Benjamite,  son of Beriah,  chief of the inhabitants of Aijalon; 1a) also 'Eder'

H5739.def: 1) flock,  herd; 1a) flock; 1b) herds,  flocks and herds

H5740.def: Eder = "a flock"; n pr m; 1) a Merarite Levite in the time of David; n pr loc; 2) a town in the extreme south of Judah on the border of Edom; site unknown

H5741.def: Adriel = "flock of God"; 1) son of Barzillai,  and the man to whom Saul gave his daughter Merab in marriage although she was already promised to David

H5742.derivation: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

H5744.def: Obed = "serving"; 1) son of Boaz by Ruth and the grandfather of David; 2) a Judaite,  a descendant of Jarha, the Egyptian slave of Sheshan, in the line of Jerahmeel; 3) a Judaite,  father of Azariah,  one of the captains of hundreds who joined with Jehoiada in the revolution by which Athaliah fell; 4) one of David's mighty warriors; 5) son of Shemaiah and a gatekeeper of the temple

H5745.def: Obal = "stripped bare"; 1) a son of Joktan and the founder of an Arab tribe

H5746.derivation: a primitive root; properly, to gyrate; but used only as a denominative from ,

H5747.def: Og = "long-necked"; 1) the Amorite king of Bashan and one of the last representatives of the giants of Rephaim

H5748.def: 1) a musical instrument; 1a) perhaps a flute, reed-pipe,  or panpipes
H5748.derivation: or ; from  in the original sense of breathing;

H5749.def: 1) to return,  repeat,  go about,  do again; 1a) (Piel) to surround,  go round and round; 1b) (Pilel) to restore,  relieve; 1c) (Hithpalel) to be restored; 2) to bear witness; 2a) (Qal) to bear witness,  say again and again; 2b) (Hiphil); 2b1) to testify,  bear witness; 2b2) to cause to testify,  take or call as witness,  invoke; 2b3) to protest,  affirm solemnly,  warn,  exhort or enjoin solemnly, admonish,  charge; 2c) (Hophal) to protest,  give warning

H5750.def: subst; 1) a going round,  continuance; adv; 2) still,  yet, again, besides; 2a) still,  yet (of continuance or persistence); 2b) still,  yet,  more (of addition or repetition); 2c) again; 2d) still,  moreover,  besides

H5752.def: Oded = "restorer"; 1) father of Azariah the prophet in the reign of king Asa of Judah; 2) a prophet of Jehovah in Samaria at the time of Pekah's invasion of Judah

H5753.def: 1) to bend,  twist,  distort; 1a) (Niphal) to be bent,  be bowed down,  be twisted,  be perverted; 1b) (Piel) to twist,  distort; 1c) (Hiphil) to do perversely; 2) to commit iniquity,  do wrong,  pervert; 2a) (Qal) to do wrong,  commit iniquity; 2b) (Hiphil) to commit iniquity

H5755.def: Ava or Ivah = "ruin"; 1) a city conquered by the Assyrians

H5756.def: 1) (Hiphil) to take refuge,  bring to refuge,  seek refuge

H5757.def: Avims or Avites = "perverters"; 1) inhabitants of Ava or Ivah

H5759.def: 1) young male or man or boy,  boy

H5761.def: Avim = "ruins"; n pr m; 1) a people among the early inhabitants of Palestine located in the southwest corner of the seacoast; n pr loc; 2) a city in Benjamin

H5762.def: Avith = "ruins"; 1) the city of Hadad Ben-Bedad, one of the kings of Edom
H5762.derivation: or perhaps ( (as if plural of ) (; from ; ruin;

H5763.def: 1) to give suck,  suckle,  nurse; 1a) (Qal) giving suck (participle)

H5765.def: 1) to act wrongfully or unjustly,  deviate from; 1a) (Piel) to act wrongfully

H5766.def: 1) injustice,  unrighteousness,  wrong; 1a) violent deeds of injustice; 1b) injustice (of speech); 1c) injustice (generally)

H5767.def: 1) unjust one,  perverse one,  unrighteous one

H5769.def: 1) long duration,  antiquity,  futurity,  for ever,  ever,  everlasting, evermore,  perpetual,  old,  ancient,  world; 1a) ancient time,  long time (of past); 1b) (of future); 1b1) for ever,  always; 1b2) continuous existence,  perpetual; 1b3) everlasting,  indefinite or unending future,  eternity

H5770.def: 1) to eye,  look at; 1a) (Qal) to eye,  look at

H5771.def: 1) perversity, depravity, iniquity,  guilt or punishment of iniquity; 1a) iniquity; 1b) guilt of iniquity,  guilt (as great),  guilt (of condition); 1c) consequence of or punishment for iniquity

H5772.derivation: from an unused root apparently meaning to dwell together;

H5774.def: v; 1) to fly,  fly about,  fly away; 1a)(Qal); 1a1) to fly,  hover; 1a2) to fly away; 1b) (Hiphil) to cause to fly,  light upon; 1c) (Polel); 1c1) to fly about or to and fro; 1c2) to cause to fly to and fro,  brandish; 1d) (Hithpolel) to fly away; 2) (Qal) to cover,  be dark; n f; 3) gloom
H5774.derivation: a primitive root; to cover (with wings or obscurity); hence (as denominative from )

H5775.def: 1) flying creatures,  fowl,  insects,  birds; 1a) fowl,  birds; 1b) winged insects

H5778.def: Ephai = "gloomy"; 1) a Netophathite,  whose sons were among the captains of the forces left in Judah after the deportation to Babylon

H5780.def: Uz = "wooded"; n pr m; 1) son of Aram and grandson of Seth; 2) son of Nahor by Milcah; 3) an Edomite,  son of Dishan and grandson of Seir; n pr loc; 4) the country of Job; probably east and southeast of Palestine somewhere in the Arabian desert

H5781.def: 1) (Hiphil) to totter,  cause to totter,  crush; 1a) meaning dubious

H5782.def: 1) to rouse oneself,  awake,  awaken,  incite; 1a) (Qal) to rouse oneself,  awake; 1b) (Niphal) to be roused; 1c) (Polel) to stir up,  rouse,  incite; 1d) (Hithpolel) to be excited,  be triumphant; 1e) (Hiphil); 1e1) to rouse,  stir up; 1e2) to act in an aroused manner,  awake
H5782.derivation: a primitive root (rather identical with through the idea of opening the eyes);

H5783.def: 1) (Niphal) to be exposed,  be bared,  be laid bare

H5785.def: 1) skin,  hide; 1a) skin (of men); 1b) hide (of animals)

H5786.def: 1) (Piel) to blind,  make blind,  put out the eyes of
H5786.derivation: a primitive root (rather denominatively from  through the idea of a film over the eyes);

H5789.def: 1) (Qal) to lend aid,  come to help,  hasten

H5790.def: 1) (Qal) to hasten to,  help,  succour; 1a) meaning dubious

H5791.def: 1) to be bent,  be crooked,  bend,  make crooked,  pervert; 1a)(Piel); 1a1) to make crooked,  falsify,  pervert,  subvert; 1a2) to bend,  make crooked; 1b) (Pual) thing bent (participle); 1c) (Hithpael) to bend oneself

H5793.def: Uthai = "helpful"; 1) son of Ammihud and a descendant of Pharez of Judah; 2) one of the sons of Bigvai who returned from exile with the 2nd caravan with Ezra

H5797.def: 1) might,  strength; 1a) material or physical; 1b) personal or social or political

H5798.def: Uzza or Uzzah = "strength"; n pr m; 1) a man slain by Jehovah for touching the sacred ark; 2) a Benjamite of the sons of Ehud; 3) ancestor of a family of temple slaves who returned from exile with Zerubbabel; 4) a Merarite Levite; n pr loc; 5) the garden where kings Manasseh and Amon of Judah were buried

H5799.def: 1) entire removal,  scapegoat; 1a) refers to the goat used for sacrifice for the sins of the people; 1b) meaning dubious

H5800.def: 1) to leave,  loose,  forsake; 1a) (Qal) to leave; 1a1) to depart from,  leave behind,  leave,  let alone; 1a2) to leave,  abandon,  forsake,  neglect,  apostatise; 1a3) to let loose,  set free,  let go,  free; 1b) (Niphal); 1b1) to be left to; 1b2) to be forsaken; 1c) (Pual) to be deserted; 2) to restore,  repair; 2a) (Qal) to repair

H5801.derivation: from  in the sense of letting go (for a price, i.e. selling);

H5802.def: Azbuk = "strong devastation"; 1) father of Nehemiah,  leader of half the district of Beth Zur,  and a repairer of the walls of Jerusalem under another Nehemiah
H5802.derivation: from  and the root of ; stern depopulator;

H5803.def: Azgad = "Gad is mighty"; 1) ancestor of a family of laymen who returned from exile with Zerubbabel; 2) a man who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah

H5804.def: Azzah = "the strong"; 1) another name for 'Gaza',   a city of the Philistines located in the extreme southwest of Palestine close to the Mediterranean

H5806.def: Azubah = "forsaken"; 1) wife of Caleb,  the son of Hezron; 2) daughter of Shilhi,  wife of king Asa,  and mother of king Jehoshaphat of Judah

H5809.def: Azur or Azzur = "he that assists"; 1) a Benjamite of Gibeon,  father of the false prophet Hananiah; 2) father of Jaazaniah,  one of the princes against whom Ezekiel was commanded to prophecy

H5810.def: 1) to be strong; 1a) (Qal) to be strong,  prevail; 1b) (Hiphil) to make firm,  strengthen

H5811.def: Azaz = "strong"; 1) a Reubenite,  father of Bela

H5812.def: Azaziah = "Jehovah is mighty"; 1) a Levite musician in the reign of David who played the harp in the procession which brought the ark from Obed-edom to Jerusalem; 2) a Levite in the reign of king Hezekiah of Judah in charge of the tithes; 3) father of Hoshea,  prince of the tribe of Ephraim when David took the census

H5813.def: Uzzi = "strong"; 1) a Levite,  son of Bukki and father of Zerahiah in the line of the high priest although apparently never high priest himself; 2) son of Tola and grandson of Issachar; 3) a Benjamite,  son of Bela and head of a family of Benjamin; 4) son of Michri and father of Elah and an ancestor of a family of returned exiles settling in Jerusalem. Maybe same as 3; 5) a Levite,  son of Bani,  and an overseer of the Levites in Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah; 6) a priest,  chief of the father's house of Jedaiah,  in the time of Joiakim the high priest; 7) one of the priests who helped Ezra in the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem. Maybe same as 6

H5814.def: Uzzia = "strength of Jehovah"; 1) one of David's mighty warriors

H5815.def: Aziel = "whom God comforts"; 1) a Levite; also 'Jaaziel'

H5816.def: Uzziel = "my strength is God"; 1) the 4th son of Kohath and grandson of Levi,  uncle of Moses and Aaron; 2) a Simeonite captain,  son of Ishi, in the days of king Hezekiah of Judah; 3) descendant of Bela,  head of a family in the tribe of Benjamin; 4) a musician of the sons of Heman in the time of David; 5) a Levite of the sons of Jeduthun in the days of king Hezekiah of Judah; 6) son of Harhaiah,  probably a priest and a goldsmith,  who took part in repairing the wall under Nehemiah

H5817.def: Uzzielites = see Uzziel "my strength is God"; 1) descendants of Uzziel

H5818.def: Uzziah = "my strength is Jehovah"; 1) son of king Amaziah of Judah and king of Judah himself for 52 years; also 'Azariah'; 2) a Kohathite Levite and ancestor of Samuel; 3) a priest of the sons of Harim who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 4) a Judaite,  father of Athaiah or Uthai; 5) father of Jehonathan,  one of David's overseers
H5818.derivation: or ; from  and ; strength of Jah;

H5819.def: Aziza = "strong"; 1) a layman of the family of Zattu who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra

H5820.def: Azmaveth = "strong unto death"; n pr m; 1) one of David's mighty warriors; 2) a descendant of Mephibosheth,  the son of Jonathan and grandson of king Saul; 3) a Benjamite,  father of Jeziel and Pelet who were two of David's men who joined him at Ziklag; 4) overseer of the royal treasures in the reign of David; n pr loc; 5) a place in Benjamin; also 'Beth-azmeveth'
H5820.derivation: from  and ; strong one of death;

H5821.def: Azzan = "very strong"; 1) father of Paltiel prince of the tribe of Issachar who represented his tribe in the division of the promised land

H5822.def: 1) an unclean bird of prey; 1a) osprey,  black eagle,  buzzard; 1b) perhaps an extinct bird,  exact meaning unknown

H5825.def: Azekah = "dug over"; 1) a town in the lowlands of Judah

H5826.def: 1) to help,  succour,  support; 1a) (Qal) to help; 1b) (Niphal) to be helped; 1c) (Hiphil) to help

H5827.def: Ezer = "treasure"; 1) son of Ephraim who was slain by inhabitants of Gath; 2) a priest who helped at the dedication of the walls of Jerusalem under Nehemiah

H5828.def: 1) help,  succour; 1a) help,  succour; 1b) one who helps

H5829.def: Ezer = "treasure"; 1) father of Hushah of the sons of Hur; 2) a Gadite chief who fought with David; 3) a Levite who aided in repairing the wall of Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah

H5830.def: Ezra = "help"; 1) the priest and scribe who led the reforms of the returned exiles in Jerusalem; co-worker with Nehemiah; 2) a priest with Zerubbabel; 3) another post-exilic Jew

H5831.def: Ezra = "help"; 1) the priest and scribe who led the reforms of the returned exiles in Jerusalem; co-worker with Nehemiah

H5832.def: Azarael or Azareel = "God has helped"; 1) a Korhite warrior of David who joined him at Ziklag; 2) a Levite musician of the family of Heman in the time of David; 3) a Danite,  son of Jeroham and a prince of the tribe at the census of David; 4) one of the sons of Bani who took a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 5) a priest,  ancestor of Maasiai or Amashai,  a priest in Jerusalem after the return from exile; 6) a priest and musician in the time of Nehemiah

H5833.def: 1) help,  succour,  assistance; 1a) help,  succour; 1b) one who helps

H5834.def: Ezra = "help"; 1) a Judaite,  father of Jether,  Mered,  Epher,  and Jalon

H5835.def: 1) enclosure; 1a) ledge (surrounding Ezekiel's altar); 1b) court (outer one of temple)
H5835.derivation: from  in its original meaning of surrounding;

H5836.def: Ezri = "help of Jehovah"; 1) son of Chelub and superintendent of king David's farm labourers

H5837.def: Azriel = "my help is God"; 1) a head of a house of the half-tribe of Manasseh beyond the Jordan; 2) a Naphtalite,  ancestor of Jerimoth,  the head of the tribe at the time of the census of David; 3) father of Seraiah,  an officer of king Jehoiakim of Judah

H5838.def: Azariah = "Jehovah has helped"; 1) son of king Amaziah of Judah and king of Judah himself for 52 years; also 'Uzziah'; 2) the godly friend of Daniel who Nebuchadnezzar renamed Abednego; one of the three friends who with Daniel refused to make themselves unclean by eating food from the king's table which went against the dietary laws which God had given the Jews; also one of the three who were thrown into the fiery furnace for refusing to bow down to a graven image of Nebuchadnezzar and who were saved by the angel of the Lord; 2a) also, 'Abednego' ( H05664 or  H05665); 3) son of Nathan and an officer of Solomon; perhaps David's grandson and Solomon's nephew; 4) a prophet in the days of king Asa of Judah; 5) son of king Jehoshaphat of Judah and brother to 5; 6) another son of king Jehoshaphat of Judah and brother to 4; 7) a priest,  son of Ahimaaz,  grandson of Zadok and high priest in the reign of king Solomon; 8) the high priest in the reign of king Uzziah of Judah; 9) a priest who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah; probably same as 18; 10) a Kohathite Levite,  father of Joel in the reign of king Hezekiah of Judah; 11) a Merarite Levite,  son of Jehalelel in the reign of king Hezekiah of Judah; 12) a Kohathite Levite,  son of Zephaniah and ancestor of Samuel the prophet; 13) a Levite who helped Ezra in instructing the people in the law; 14) son of Jeroham and one of the temple captains of Judah in the time of queen Athaliah; probably the same as 21; 15) son of Maaseiah who repaired part of the wall of Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah; 16) one of the leaders who returned from Babylon with Zerubbabel; 17) a man who assisted in the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah; probably the same as 10; 18) son of Johanan,  one of the captains of Ephraim in the reign of king Ahaz of Judah; 19) a Judaite,  son of Ethan of the sons of Zerah; 20) a Judaite,  son of Jehu of the family of the Jerahmeelites and descended from Jarha the Egyptian slave of Sheshan; probably one of the captains of the time of queen Athaliah and the same as 15; 21) a priest,  son of Hilkiah; 22) a priest,  son of Johanan; 23) son of king Jehoram of Judah; probably clerical error for 'Ahaziah'; 24) son of Meraioth; 25) son of Hoshaiah and one of the proud men who confronted Jeremiah
H5838.derivation: or ; from  and ; Jah has helped;

H5839.def: Azariah = "Jehovah has helped"; 1) the godly friend of Daniel who Nebuchadnezzar renamed Abednego; one of the three friends who with Daniel refused to make themselves unclean by eating food from the king's table which went against the dietary laws which God had given the Jews; also one of the three who were thrown into the fiery furnace for refusing to bow down to a graven image of Nebuchadnezzar and who were saved by the angel of the Lord; 1a) also, 'Abednego' ( H05664 or  H05665)

H5840.def: Azrikam = "help against the enemy"; 1) son of Neariah and descendant of Zerubbabel of the royal line of Judah; 2) a Benjamite, eldest son of Azel and descendant of Saul; 3) a Levite,  ancestor of Shemaiah in the time of Nehemiah; 4) governor of the palace of king Ahaz of Judah and victim of murder by Zichri
H5840.derivation: from  and active participle of ; help of an enemy;

H5841.def: Gazathites or Gazites = see Gaza "the strong"; 1) an inhabitant of the city of Gaza

H5842.def: 1) stylus; 1a) iron stylus with diamond tip used to write on stone or metal; 1b) reed pen used on a roll
H5842.derivation: from  (contracted) in the sense of swooping, i.e. side-long stroke;

H5844.def: 1) to cover,  enwrap,  wrap oneself,  envelop oneself; 1a) (Qal); 1a1) to wrap,  envelop oneself; 1a2) to cover (the beard in mourning); 1a3) mourner,  one who covers (participle); 1b) (Hiphil) to cover,  enwrap,  envelop; 2) to grasp; 2a) (Qal) to grasp

H5845.derivation: from an unused root meaning apparently to contain;

H5846.derivation: from an unused root meaning to sneeze;

H5848.def: 1) to turn aside; 1a) (Qal) to turn aside,  turn (in order to cover); 2) to envelop oneself; 2a) (Qal) to envelop oneself,  cover; 3) to be feeble,  be faint,  grow weak; 3a) (Qal) to be feeble,  be faint; 3b) (Niphal) to faint; 3c) (Hiphil) to show feebleness; 3d) (Hithpael) to faint,  faint away

H5849.def: 1) to surround; 1a) (Qal) to surround; 2) to crown,  give a crown; 2a) (Piel) to crown; 2b) (Hiphil) crown-bestower (participle)

H5851.def: Atarah = "a crown"; 1) wife of Jerahmeel and mother of Onam

H5852.def: Ataroth = "crowns"; 1) a town east of the Jordan in Gilead,  taken and built by the tribe of Gad; 2) a place on the boundary of Ephraim and Manasseh; 3) a place between Ephraim and Benjamin

H5853.def: Ataroth-adar or Ataroth-addar = "crowns of glory"; 1) a Gadite town on the west border of Benjamin
H5853.derivation: from the same as  and ; crowns of Addar;

H5854.def: Ataroth = "the crowns of"; 1) the house of Joab,  a place in Judah
H5854.derivation: from the same as  and  and ; crowns of the house of Joab;

H5855.def: Atroth-shophan = "crowns of their rapine"; 1) a town in the territory of Gad
H5855.derivation: from the same as  and a name otherwise unused (being from the same as ) meaning hidden; crowns of Shophan;

H5857.def: Ai or Aija or Aiath or Hai = "heap of ruins"; 1) a city lying east of Bethel and beside Bethaven near Jericho and the second city taken on the invasion of Canaan; 2) a city of the Ammonites on the east of the Jordan and apparently attached to Heshbon

H5858.def: Ebal = "stone" or "bare mountain"; n pr m; 1) a son of Shobal; n pr loc; 2) mountain of cursing,  north of Shechem and opposite Mount Gerizim
H5858.derivation: perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to be bald; bare;

H5859.def: Ijon = "a ruin"; 1) a place in the north of Palestine belonging to the tribe of Naphtali

H5860.def: 1) to scream,  shriek; 1a) (Qal) to scream; 2) to dart greedily,  swoop upon,  rush upon; 2a) (Qal) to dart greedily

H5862.def: Etam = "lair of wild beasts"; 1) a village of the tribe of Simeon; 2) a town in Judah fortified and garrisoned by king Rehoboam of Judah and located between Bethlehem and Tekoa; 3) a cliff; site uncertain

H7967.def: Shallum = "retribution"; 1) son of Jabesh,  conspirator and slayer of king Zachariah of the northern kingdom of Israel ending the dynasty of Jehu; assumed the throne and became the 15th king of the northern kingdom; reigned for one month and was killed by Menahem; 2) the 3rd son of king Josiah of Judah and subsequent king of Judah; reigned for 3 months before he was taken captive to Egypt where he was placed in chains and later died; 2a) also 'Jehoahaz'; 3) husband of Huldah the prophetess in the reign of king Josiah of Judah. Maybe the same as 4; 4) uncle of Jeremiah the prophet. Maybe the same as 3; 5) a Simeonite,  son of Shaul and grandson of Simeon; 6) a Judaite,  son of Sisamai and father of Jekamiah in the family of Jerahmeel; 7) an Ephraimite,  father of Jehizkiah; 8) a son of Naphtali; 9) a Korahite Levite,  chief of a family of gatekeepers for the east gate of the temple; 9a) maybe same as 13; 10) son of Halohesh and ruler of a district of Jerusalem; also repairer of the wall of Jerusalem in the time of Nehemiah; 11) a priest,  of the family of Eleazar,  son of Zadok and father of Hilkiah in the family line of Ezra; 12) a Korahite Levite,  son of Kore,  father of Maaseiah,  and in charge of the work of the service. Maybe same as 9; 13) a Levite gatekeeper who had a foreign wife in the time of Ezra; 14) a Levite and descendant of Bani who had a foreign wife in the time of Ezra

Spelled 'Shemuel'; 3) son of Tola and grandson of Issachar. Spelled 'Shemuel'

H8065.def: 1) heaven,  heavens,  sky; 1a) visible sky; 1b) Heaven (as abode of God)
